methods.description: View the facet information corresponding to a search

parameters.name: searchTerms
parameters.description: URL-encoded keyword or keywords desired by the client; OpenSearch 1.1

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of search results per page desired by the client; OpenSearch 1.1

parameters.name: startIndex
parameters.description: First search result desired by the search client; OpenSearch 1.1

parameters.name: spatial
parameters.description: 4 comma separated values - W, S, E, N; OpenSearch-Geo 1.0, "box" parameter

parameters.name: sortKeys
parameters.description: Sort the results by most relevant (default), smallest or largest spatial area, shortest or longest temporal duration, or most recently updated; partial implementation of OpenSearch SRU 1.0

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date in yyyy-mm-dd format

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date in yyyy-mm-dd format

parameters.name: facetFilters
parameters.description: Describes faceted restrictions on the search. A URL-encoded JSON object where the keys are the names of the facet, and the values are arrays of the selected facet values

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Custom parameter for selecting which source to use; the Arctic Data Explorer (ADE) uses data aggregated from many sources, including, but not limited to, NSIDC

methods.description: Search documents using the OpenSearch 1.1 Specification

methods.description: Describes the web interface of NSIDC's data search engine
Suggest search terms based on a partial query

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search terms typed into the interface (minimum two characters)

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Custom parameter for selecting which source to use; the Arctic Data Explorer (ADE) uses data aggregated from many sources, including, but not limited to, NSIDC

apiDescription: This API allows programmers to build National Snow and Ice Data Center data and metadata services into their applications.
